result.execSummary:
The defendant Clifford Paul Bergemann was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay within 60 days or you will need to set up a payment plan. Payment plan enrollments are in person on Monday of each week.

May be served in Waushara County.   Huber privileges are granted pursuant to Sec. 303.08(1) Stats. and subject to the rules of the Portage County Sheriff's Department.
Consecutive to: to any other sentence

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Clifford Paul Bergemann

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Clifford Paul Bergemann in court with attorney Jerod Barkley. Defendant Clifford Paul Bergemann in custody. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case 15CF268 is set for initial. 15CM94, 14CT222, 15CM11, 14CM494, and 15CM78 are set for plea hearings.
ADA Knaapen informs the Court that 14CT222(OWI 4th) is to be dismissed and is now filed as 15CF268 (OWI 5th).
BTC: 14CT222 is Dismissed.

15CF268 Initial Appearance held, waived reading of complaint. 
Waived Preliminary Hearing and Court finds the Defendant freely & voluntarily waives hearing and finds probable cause and binds over. 
Arraignment held. Information filed and waived reading.

Plea hearings on 15CF268 Count 1 (OWI 5th), 15CM94 Count 1 (Bail Jumping), and 15CM11 Count 1 (Bail Jumping).
Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
15CF268 Count 1: No Contest
15CM11 Count 1: No Contest
15CM94 Count 1: No Contest

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty15CF268 Count 1, 15CM11 Count 1,  and 15CM94 Count 1:.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
 15CF268 Count 2 is dismissed, 15CM94 Cts 2 & 3, 15CM11 Ct 2, 14CM494, and 15CM78 are Dismissed Read In.  Bonds are revoked.

ADA Knaapen makes joint sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Barkely concurs and makes sentencing arguments to the Court and request jail to be served in Waushara County. 

BY THE COURT:
15CF268 Count 1 - OWI 5th: Imposed & stayed Sentence:  Prison 2 yrs Incarcerated & 2 yrs Extended Supervision - stayed
24 mo Probation:
Conditional 180 days jail, consecutive to sentence currently serving, 20 days credit, can be served in in Waushara County w/huber. Report immediately
$1,200 + costs + DNA surcharge ($250).
Provide a DNA Sample, if not done already.
$26.45 Blood Draw costs
36 mo Revocation
36 mo IID
DOT/AODA Assessment

15CM11 Count 1: 60 days jail, consecutive. Pay costs. 16 days credit.

15CM94 Count 1: 60 days jail, consecutive. Pay costs. 49 days credit.

ADDRESS INFO for Clifford Paul Bergemann
Current: 1709 S 8th St, Apt 4, Milwaukee, WI 53204-3553 United States  (Effective: 05-21-2015)
Prior: 1700 Monroe St # 17, Stevens Point, WI 54481
Status conference on May 4, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Pre-trial conference on March 2, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Attorney Jerod Barkley in court. Defendant Clifford Paul Bergemann appeared by video. Prosecuting Atty Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for State of Wisconsin.
  
Attorney/Defendant received copy of criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of complaint.

NOT GUILTY pleas entered.

Bond Continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 2, 2015 at 09:00 am.
State Public Defender - Order Appointing Counsel Atty Barkley

ADA Cousins appears in Court.  
Defendant appears from jail by video.

1:27 PM Court calls case.
Court states appearances.

ADA Cousins  states facts for anticipated charges of  Misdemeanor Bailjumping.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.
Court informs Defendant right to an attorney and/or Public Defender.
Defendant states that he has Atty Jerod Barkley on another matter.
Defendant requests signature bond, has pet birds and a pet dog.

Court questions Defendant. 

State requests a $1,500 cash bond  with conditions as stated.
Defendant addresses the Court, gets paid on the third of January.

Initial Appearance Scheduled for: January 12, 2015    @ 1:30 p.m.  in Branch 1
Comply with all conditions set forth in all other bonds.
